bug.author: tshrjn
bug.summary: Web App AutoViz creates New Names based on time & hostname
bug.description:
wandb --version && python --version && uname
Weights and Biases version: 0.8.14 Python version: 3.7.5 Operating System: Linux
The auto viz tool on the web app is making a new chart each time with date & hostname, & isn't plotting on the same section. Also, if multiple sections are open, I'm unable to scroll down on the webpage.

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.92. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tshrjn>@tshrjn</denchmark-link> can you add a link to the page you‚Äôre seeing this on?

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tshrjn>@tshrjn</denchmark-link> , how are you logging your metrics? Those metrics names are defined by the keys in your calls to . Are you calling wandb.log manually or using a callback?
Using sync_tensorboard at init and logging via torch.utils.tensorboard. It was because of import order, import wandb before torch resolved it.
Good to know, I think it was namespacing your runs by the logdir which had a date in it. When you change the order are you still seeing all the metrics you're logging to tboard?
